title: Mass. men sentenced to prison for mail theft, check fraud scheme
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Imanol Rios-Franco and Brandon Baez were sentenced for bank fraud and mail theft in Massachusetts.
Rios-Franco received 35 months in prison and must pay $12,528 in restitution; Baez got two years and owes $10,285.
The men stole and altered mailed checks from USPS boxes, depositing them into controlled accounts, officials said.

title: Milford teen detained by ICE last year invited to State of the Union address
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Marcelo Gomes da Silva, a Milford teen, was detained by ICE in May 2025 and invited to the State of the Union.
Rep. Seth Moulton invited Gomes to attend President Trump's speech addressing immigration enforcement on February 24, 2026.
Gomes' detention led to community protests, highlighting his story as emblematic of issues in the U.S. immigration system.

title: Jeremy Swayman shares humorous response to regrettable goal in first Olympic start
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed a center-ice goal against Denmark in his first Olympic start for Team USA.
Swayman attributed the goal to losing sight of the puck, joking about being colorblind regarding puck visibility theories.
Despite Swayman's performance, the U.S. defeated Denmark with strong offense, ensuring the win in the preliminary match.

title: NBA stars and legends weigh in on Jayson Tatum’s potential return this season
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jayson Tatum may return this season from an Achilles injury, generating considerable speculation and anticipation at the NBA All-Star event.
Kevin Durant anticipates Jayson Tatum will perform at an All-Star level upon returning, based on his own Achilles recovery experience.
Carmelo Anthony suggests Tatum's return could significantly boost the Celtics' playoff potential by allowing strategic lineup flexibility.

title: 5 free agents that might make the most sense for Patriots to pursue at positions of need
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots have $41 million in cap space and are looking to strengthen key positions this offseason.
Potential free agent targets include Colts WR Alec Pierce, Packers OT Rasheed Walker, and Ravens TE Isaiah Likely.
With contract extensions looming, Patriots may prioritize adding offensive linemen like Bills C Connor McGovern.

title: Making some sense of the new ESPN/MLB.TV streaming partnership and what it means to fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: ESPN is the new streaming home for MLB.TV, available as an add-on to ESPN Unlimited for $134.99 per season.
Non-ESPN Unlimited subscribers can buy MLB.TV for $149.99, including a free month of ESPN Unlimited, which renews at $29.99/month.
Existing MLB.TV subscribers are auto-renewed and offered a free ESPN Unlimited trial; linking accounts is needed for streaming access.

title: ‘We’re real excited’: Celtics’ Ron Harper Jr. shares Jayson Tatum looked like himself in recent G League practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum participated in a G League practice with the Maine Celtics, sparking speculation about his potential return.
Celtics' Ron Harper Jr. commented on Tatum's performance, noting he played like himself, but no return is confirmed.
Tatum has been practicing with coaches and engaging in five-on-five scrimmages, but the team set no return timeline yet.

title: Here’s where Mass. finished on the latest list of most educated states
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts ranked as the most educated state in the recent WalletHub study for 2026.
Over 47% of Massachusetts adults hold a bachelor's degree, and nearly 22% have advanced degrees.
Vermont and Maryland followed Massachusetts in education rankings, while Louisiana, Mississippi, and West Virginia were last.

title: One of the rarest baseball cards is up for auction â€” and there are local connections
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: A rare T206 Honus Wagner baseball card is up for auction, closing on February 21, with a current bid of $3.9 million.
The card was owned by Morton Bernstein's family, linked to Taunton, Massachusetts, and has never been sold or graded before.
Ken Goldin discovered the card, which is highlighted in Netflix's 'King of Collectibles,' noting it as a major hobby discovery.

title: Bruins G Jeremy Swayman set to make Olympic debut and start for Team USA vs. Denmark
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Bruins goalie Jeremy Swayman will start for Team USA against Denmark in the 2026 Winter Olympics on Saturday.
Swayman has a 22-12-3 record, 2.92 GAA, and .903 save percentage for the 2025-26 season.
Bruins defenseman Charlie McAvoy will also play, having been part of Team USA's top defensive pairing.
